page.title: 06EDUCATION IN DURSLEY
page.content: In 1971 Secondary School re-organisation resulted in the establishment of the Rednock Comprehensive School in Dursley on the site of the old grammar school. The Secondary Modern school buildings at Highfields were occupied by Junior children who had been accommodated on a split site in the town. Infants were also housed at Highfields from 1982. At the present there are 119 Infants and 202 Juniors at Dursley Primary School, Highfields. They are taught by 15 full-time and 20 part-time teaching staff. There are no official school coaches but the parents have arranged the hire of a bus which transports about 40 children daily from Dursley town centre area. About 30 children have a school meal and 200 have sandwiches.
